intro: Schellolepis verrucosa, commonly known as the roughleaf spurge, is a perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Schellolepis verrucosa is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
